alert.note: Alert for Susitna Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 07 at 3:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: .Widespread heavy rain is forecast to move into the Susitna Valley that has the potential to cause flooding across the area. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Including the following area, Susitna Valley. This includes the cities of Talkeetna And Willow. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Widespread rain is expected to move into the Susitna Valley Thursday morning with prolonged periods of moderate rain expected in the Talkeetna Mountains through Friday afternoon. Rainfall totals of between four and six inches are possible in the Talkeetna Mountains. - Http://www.weather.gov/aprfc Concerned parties along the Little Susitna River and Willow Creek should be prepared for high water levels.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
